meanings.definition: A person or thing that clings.
meanings.sent1: The little boy was one of the clingers who held onto his mother's hand tightly.
meanings.sent2: The vines in the forest are known as clingers because they wrap around trees for support.
meanings.sent3: The clingers in the haunted house turned out to be friendly ghosts who just wanted company.
meanings.sent4: The memories of childhood are like clingers, always present and holding onto our hearts.
meanings.sent5: The clingers in the garden were the ivy plants that grew up the walls, clinging to them for support.

meanings.sent1: At the party, the clingers were the group of friends who stuck together all night.
meanings.sent2: The clingers at the beach were the seashells that attached themselves to rocks along the shore.
meanings.sent3: The clingers in the movie theater were the audience members who refused to leave even after the film ended.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the night sky were like clingers, shining brightly and holding onto their places.
meanings.sent5: The clingers on the playground were the children who always stayed close to the teacher during recess.
